results.title: Building of the earth
results.brief_description: Examines volcanic action and plate tectonics, the extreme cold of polar and high altitude regions, and how living organisms have adapted those environments. Teachers advised to view in advance so that segments may be identified as appropriate to concentration spans.

results.title: Building Lindy's house
results.brief_description: Illustrates the selection of a block of land suitable for building a home. Shows the specialised work of different tradesmen employed in building a house and points out how the different building processes are co-ordinated.

results.title: Building in Tolmie
results.brief_description: The Valcich’s fell in love with Tolmie, in north-eastern Victoria, the moment they saw it – 12 years on, they are still building their dream home on their block of paradise. Little by little they have assembled a unique and sustainable home using timber and stone from their land and a multitude of reclaimed materials. These gentle souls tell us a little bit about what Tolmie means to them and how they have been able to contribute to the community through the CFA and various social groups over the years.

results.title: Building houses
results.brief_description: A survey of the major operations involved in the construction of a modern house: preparation of plans by architects; stripping of site and laying of foundations; subsequent work of bricklayers, carpenters, tilers, plumbers, glaziers, electricians, plasterers, painters and others. The commentary points out that the finished house is the result of the combined efforts of a large team of craftsmen.

results.title: Building for learning
results.brief_description: As the Victorian population increases, the problem of providing school buildings and accomodation becomes more and more accentuated. The purpose of this film is to show the progress being made in this regard, and the problems associated with the building shortage. It also demonstrates the work being done in the various departments of the school and provides a valuable opportunity of showing to children, teachers, parents and other interested adults just what is being done in Victoria to meet the demands of a growing population for the best and the latest in the educational field. Commentary by Max Meldrum, drawings by Betty Jope.

results.title: Building Evacuation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Runners, floor wardens, chief warden, warning systems, communication systems, Master Emergency Communication Point, assembly areas, mobility impaired people, order of evacuation, when to evacuate…these are just some of the details that need to be considered in the evacuation of a building. Every person in a building needs to know their role in an evacuation. This video addresses the principles of evacuation of any building.

results.title: Building dreams
results.creator_credit: Yuri Sokol, Michael Le Moignan and Corroboree Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Black futures (A)”.
Until recently, the 150,000 Australians who are of Aboriginal descent had little hope of ever owning a home or getting a permanent job. Now, young Aboriginal building apprentices are putting up first class new homes for their own communities. Better living conditions are helping Aboriginal people to maintain their own distinct sense of identity and boosting their self-confidence.

results.title: Building belief. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
Dorothy Heathcote continues her work with a class of nine and ten year old American children. Using drama to create focus and feeling, she poses three moral dilemmas, where the children are confronted with crises involving leadership, old-age, and death. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.
